titleInfo.title: MOTION TO INSTRUCT CONFEREES ON H.R. 2810, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO INSTRUCT CONFEREES ON H.R. 2810, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 164

congVote.result: So the motion to instruct was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2018_Motion to go to Conference
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed by unanimous consent to disagree to the Senate amendment and request a conference on H.R. 2810, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2018 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, and to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year.<P/>Rejected the Langevin motion to instruct conferees by a yea-and-nay vote of 184 yeas to 237 nays, Roll No. 564.

titleInfo.title: MOTION TO CLOSE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE MEETINGS ON H.R. 2810, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018

extension.searchTitle: MOTION TO CLOSE CONFERENCE COMMITTEE MEETINGS ON H.R. 2810, NATIONAL DEFENSE AUTHORIZATION ACT FOR FISCAL YEAR 2018; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 164

congVote.result: So the motion to close portions of the conference was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: National Defense Authorization Act for Fiscal Year 2018_Motion to go to Conference
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed by unanimous consent to disagree to the Senate amendment and request a conference on H.R. 2810, to authorize appropriations for fiscal year 2018 for military activities of the Department of Defense, for military construction, and for defense activities of the Department of Energy, and to prescribe military personnel strengths for such fiscal year.<P/>Rejected the Langevin motion to instruct conferees by a yea-and-nay vote of 184 yeas to 237 nays, Roll No. 564.<P/>Agreed to the Thornberry motion to close portions of the conference by a yea-and-nay vote of 414 yeas to 8 nays, Roll No. 565.

titleInfo.title: ADDITIONAL SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR DISASTER RELIEF REQUIREMENTS ACT, 2017

extension.searchTitle: ADDITIONAL SUPPLEMENTAL APPROPRIATIONS FOR DISASTER RELIEF REQUIREMENTS ACT, 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 164

congVote.result: So (two-thirds being in the affirmative) the rules were suspended and the resolution was agreed to.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory2: Providing for the concurrence by the House in the Senate amendment to H.R. 2266, with an amendment
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House agreed to suspend the rules and agree to the following measure:<P/>H. Res. 569, providing for the concurrence by the House in the Senate amendment to H.R. 2266, with an amendment, by a \2/3\ yea-and-nay vote of 353 yeas to 59 nays, Roll No. 566.

titleInfo.title: DR. CHRIS KIRKPATRICK WHISTLEBLOWER PROTECTION ACT OF 2017

extension.searchTitle: DR. CHRIS KIRKPATRICK WHISTLEBLOWER PROTECTION ACT OF 2017; Congressional Record Vol. 163, No. 164

congVote.result: So the motion to recommit was rejected.
congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Dr. Chris Kirkpatrick Whistleblower Protection Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed S. 585, to provide greater whistleblower protections for Federal employees, increased awareness of Federal whistleblower protections, and increased accountability and required discipline for Federal supervisors who retaliate against whistleblowers, by a recorded vote of 420 ayes with none voting ``no'', Roll No. 568.<P/>Rejected the O'Halleran motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 190 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 567.

congVote.dailyDigestCategory1: Dr. Chris Kirkpatrick Whistleblower Protection Act of 2017
Dr. Chris Kirkpatrick Whistleblower Protection Act of 2017
congVote.dailyDigestSummary: The House passed S. 585, to provide greater whistleblower protections for Federal employees, increased awareness of Federal whistleblower protections, and increased accountability and required discipline for Federal supervisors who retaliate against whistleblowers, by a recorded vote of 420 ayes with none voting ``no'', Roll No. 568.

The House passed S. 585, to provide greater whistleblower protections for Federal employees, increased awareness of Federal whistleblower protections, and increased accountability and required discipline for Federal supervisors who retaliate against whistleblowers, by a recorded vote of 420 ayes with none voting ``no'', Roll No. 568.<P/>Rejected the O'Halleran motion to recommit the bill to the Committee on Oversight and Government Reform with instructions to report the same back to the House forthwith with an amendment, by a yea-and-nay vote of 190 yeas to 232 nays, Roll No. 567.
